page.title: 20The Women's Institute Market
page.content: The W.I. market is held on Friday mornings from 10-11a.m. in the Old Schoolroom.Stalls are set up which sell produce that is homegrown or homemade,the standard of craftwork on sale being very high. Keen purchasers arrive early and jostle for choice consumables,browsers arriving a little later when the hubbub is a little less frantic. Woodwork,pottery and even hand engraved glass are for sale.Household items such as pillow-slips,tea-cosies, cot covers,pot-holders and table cloths are amongst the sewing and knitting that may be found. Homegrown vegetables on sale this July included lettuces and cucumbers.Cakes and biscuits sold quickly and for those finishing their buying there was a refreshing cup of tea.
